description.narrative: Capacities of stakeholders in Uzbekistan to plan for, access, manage, and monitor climate change finance at the national and subnational levels developed

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

comment.narrative:
Result 1. 1.1. NDA Secretariat has been formally established and institutionalized within Uzhydromet, internal documentation developed and adopted. The structure of the Inter-Agency Working Group is being revised, due to structural changes in government organizations and their representatives. Project proposal for GCF Readiness project Phase-2 has been developed and submitted to GCF through Readiness and Preparatory Support window. The proposal has been approved by the GCF during the last Board Meeting. 1.2. The online platform established by the project is functional, being updated and available in three languages. Uzhydromet will take over the maintenance of the web-site after the closure of the project, thus ensuring sustainability of the result.
Result 2. 2.1. The project pipeline has been revised and one project idea has been removed, due to withdrawal of the proposal by the AE. Two more projects have been added to the pipeline: 1) NAP proposal and 2) GCF Readiness project (2 phase). Booth projects have been approved by the GCF. 2.2. The SAP funding proposal on improvement of MHEWS has been developed and provided to UNDP IRH for internal review and further submission to GCF for funding. The process of preparation of the funding proposal on development of agrometeorology services was withheld by AE, UN Environment, due to unclear feedback about the concept note submitted. The process will be resumed as soon the situation will be clarified by the GCF. Feasibility study has been developed for project idea on energy efficient rural housing, which is being developed by UNDP and the Ministry of Construction for further submission to GCF for funding.
Result 5. 5.1 Monitoring of project activities are conducted on daily basis, including weekly reports provided to the national implementing partner of the project, Uzhydromet; 5.2 Adaptive management approach is applied by SDC and project to ensure achievements of results of the project.
